page.title: 07The Midland Railway Trust
page.content: The Centre is a good place to visit.You can have a ride on an old steam train.There are 20 steam locomotives and 6 diesel locomotives. There are toilets,shops,a car park,a children's playing area,a picnic site and a lot of other exciting things.They have got some very old steam trains there.The railway was built in{1865}for carrying coal.The track is about 4 miles long.They have got a coach which{King George The {Fifth}travelled on.They have got a signal box, which came from Ais Gill, used to be the highest in the country.The Midland Railway is at Butterley near Ripley and Swanwick. Under development is a shed which will be a place for you to see the trains. They are making a museum on land reclaimed from an old pit spoil heap.
